answerText: Supermassive Black Hole [prompt on partial answer][10] Supermassive Black Holes are conjectured to power these luminous centers of some galaxies that can produce more output than the rest of the galaxy put together. Examples include Seyfert galaxies and Quasars.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 11 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: .One of these at the center of Messier 87 has a mass of several billion solar masses. For ten points each: [10] Name these massive astronomical entities which are theorized to be at the center of galaxies. The nearest one to earth is found in the Sagittarius constellation.
